content.description: Up the crack weakness to the right of the roof.  There is a short roof about halfway up.
content.location: On the right (North) side of the buttress where the roof comes to a prompt end. Up the weakness and crack to the right.

content.description: Straight up through the roof and onto good holds on the face above.  Watch out for bats around the roof.
content.location: In the middle of the buttress, there is an obvious weakness where the lower wall bulges out making the roof manageable - climb straight up this face and crack.

content.description: Left (around the corner a few feet) of Dave's Dangle is a route that starts with a thin crack, moves up past a small roof (crack splits the roof), and then direct up the face.
content.protection: Cams (C4 sizes) .75, .2, .4, 2, red ball nut, some medium sized nut. No anchors of course, but a giant sunken chock stone on the top can be slung and extended to setup a top rope anchor.

content.description:
This buttress is back in the woods North of the Kanaranzi and Little Ranzi Buttresses.  The buttress itself is characterized by a 2 foot to 4 foot roof that spans almost the whole buttress. 

  Bring medium to large gear for topropes.
